New Records: Argentina won the 2024 Copa América for the 16th time
Key Match Events: Argentina won the final against Colombia with a score of 1-0 in extra time
Lautaro Martínez scored the winning goal in the 112th minute
Argentina defeated Canada 2-0 in the semi-finals
Uruguay defeated Colombia 0-1 in the semi-finals
Colombia defeated Panama 5-0 in the quarter-finals
Argentina defeated Ecuador 1-1 in the quarter-finals and won the penalty shootout
Venezuela defeated Canada 1-1 in the quarter-finals and lost the penalty shootout
Uruguay defeated Brazil 0-0 in the quarter-finals and won the penalty shootout
Pre-Game Insights: Argentina was the defending champion and was expected to perform well
Colombia was considered a strong contender for the title
Uruguay and Brazil were also considered strong teams
Post-Match Reflections: Argentina's coach praised the team's performance and dedication
Colombia's coach expressed disappointment and frustration with the team's performance
Lautaro Martínez was hailed as a hero for scoring the winning goal
Miscellaneous Highlights: The tournament was held in the United States and featured 16 teams from CONMEBOL and CONCACAF
The tournament was played from June 20 to July 14, 2024
The top scorer of the tournament was Lautaro Martínez with 5 goals
Others: The tournament was broadcast in many countries around the world
The Panini Group produced thematic stickers and a sticker album for the tournament
The official mascot of the tournament was an eagle named 'Capitán'
